column5: Sorry if it's a seemingly obvious question, but I'm just curious as to what diameter thread you would use for a 13ft float rod.

You can use A size thread an any freshwater rod you want to build. The heaveier threads are best for heavier applications like saltwater trolling rods etc. Any heavier than A and all you are doing is adding unnecessary weight to your finished rod.
Like Dave mentioned, Size A will work for just about every freshwater application.  Over 95% of the rods I've built was with Gudebrod size A thread in various colours.
Definitely A thread, I use nothing else.

If I may add another question, I'm planning on tying 2 x 13 ft float rods, and a few ice rods.  Any ideas on an amount of thread I should order for this type of project?  How about the epoxy?  Is it worth ordering in a larger amount for future projects?
also, what kind of guide sizes do you guys like to use for your pin rods? how about your cork handle lengths ? i'm looking for any tips you guys have for a noob.
